intro: Halosarcia indica subsp. bidens, commonly known as the coastal morning glory, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in sandy or rocky soils along the shoreline. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. It has a sprawling growth habit and is often found in areas with high salt exposure. Its botanical features make it well adapted to harsh coastal environments.
